wikipedia_page.main: Danny Hinshelwood (born 4 December 1975) is an English former professional footballer. He is currently manager of non-league side Selsey.

response: The club in January 2000 employed former Brighton & Hove Albion defender, Danny Hinshelwood as player manager at the age of 24. Under his management the club went on to win the Sussex Royal Ulster Rifles Charity Cup in the 2001–02 season, followed by the John O'Hara League Cup the following season. In their eighth season in Division one Hinselwood left the club in July 2003 due to the club reducing the playing budget, and the club was relegated at the end of the season. Manager Danny Hinselwood returned to the club the following season after Richie Reynolds resigned and in the 2005–06 season, they finished as runners-up in Division Two and were promoted to Division One.
